    • Constructor Detail

      • EnergyReadingCollector

        public EnergyReadingCollector()
        Initializes with a default delay setting of 10 milliseconds

      • EnergyReadingCollector

        public EnergyReadingCollector​(int d)
        Initializes with the delay interval passed as paramter
        Parameters:
        d - The delay interval to take readings

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Called and run internally by the Thread class. Runs a loop, continually reading energy consumption over the delay interval and stores the reading. Loop is controlled by an internal boolean, which is set to stop once the main thread calls this.stopReading()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • startReading

        public void startReading()
        Starts a thread with this object. Continually takes and stores energy readings in the background while main thread runs. Will run until this.stopReading() is called

      • stopReading

        public void stopReading()
        Stops the thread this object is running. Sets the exit flag to true, which ends the loop in the run() method.

      • reInit

        public void reInit()
        Resets the object for reuse.
        Call this if you intend to reuse the same object for energy collection after already using it.
        Clears out the current list of readings stored in the object.

      • getLastKReadings

        public double[][] getLastKReadings​(int k)
        Returns K most recent readings. Each readings is a double[] of the form
        [dram energy, core energy, package energy].
        If K is greater than the amount of readings, returns all readings
        Parameters:
        k - Number of most recent readings
        Returns:
        An array of the K most recent readings.

      • getDelay

        public int getDelay()
        Returns:
        The current delay interval (in milliseconds)

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay​(int d)
        Parameters:
        d - Sets the delay interval (in milliseconds)

      • getNumReadings

        public int getNumReadings()
        Returns:
        number of readings currently stored in the object

      • writeReadingsToFile

        public void writeReadingsToFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Dumps all readings to file, along with the delay between readings. Format: Same format as this.toString()
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of file to write to

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object
        Format:

        dram: (joules) core: (joules) pkg: (joules)
